page.title: 01DOMESDAY BLOCK -General.
page.content: This area,situated in West Yorkshire is a good example of British moorland and its surroundings.The main land cover is the moor which is rich in plants and wildlife.The major plant that covers most of the moor is the heather. The three major towns in this area are Micklethwaite,Riddlesden and Morton.Out of these three,the biggest is Riddlesden,followed by Morton,then Micklethwaite.There are no major factories or industrial works around,but this area used to have some from the industrial revolution,but they are unused nowadays. In the three villages there are mainly houses,although there are a few shops.The main features are the moor, the towns,the canals,the roads and the school.
